verses.verse: Why <S%H4100><s%> do the heathen <S%H1471><s%> rage, <S%H7283><s%> and the people <S%H3816><s%> imagine <S%H1897><s%> a vain thing? <S%H7385><s%>

The kings <S%H4428><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> set themselves, <S%H3320><s%> and the rulers <S%H7336><s%> take counsel <S%H3245><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and against <S%H5921><s%> his anointed, <S%H4899><s%> saying,
Let us break their bands asunder, <S%H5423><s%> <S%H853><s%> <S%H4147><s%> and cast away <S%H7993><s%> their cords <S%H5688><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> us.
He that sitteth <S%H3427><s%> in the heavens <S%H8064><s%> shall laugh: <S%H7832><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> shall have them in derision. <S%H3932><s%>
Then <S%H227><s%> shall he speak <S%H1696><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> them in his wrath, <S%H639><s%> and vex <S%H926><s%> them in his sore displeasure. <S%H2740><s%>
Yet have I <S%H589><s%> set <S%H5258><s%> my king <S%H4428><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> my holy <S%H6944><s%> hill <S%H2022><s%> of Zion. <S%H6726><s%>

I will declare <S%H5608><s%> <S%H413><s%> the decree: <S%H2706><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath said <S%H559><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me, Thou <S%H859><s%> art my Son; <S%H1121><s%> this day <S%H3117><s%> have I <S%H589><s%> begotten <S%H3205><s%> thee.

Ask <S%H7592><s%> of <S%H4480><s%> me, and I shall give <S%H5414><s%> thee the heathen <S%H1471><s%> for thine inheritance, <S%H5159><s%> and the uttermost parts <S%H657><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> for thy possession. <S%H272><s%>
Thou shalt break <S%H7489><s%> them with a rod <S%H7626><s%> of iron; <S%H1270><s%> thou shalt dash them in pieces <S%H5310><s%> like a potter's <S%H3335><s%> vessel. <S%H3627><s%>
Be wise <S%H7919><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> therefore, O ye kings: <S%H4428><s%> be instructed, <S%H3256><s%> ye judges <S%H8199><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Serve <S%H5647><s%> <S%H853><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> with fear, <S%H3374><s%> and rejoice <S%H1523><s%> with trembling. <S%H7461><s%>

Kiss <S%H5401><s%> the Son, <S%H1248><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he be angry, <S%H599><s%> and ye perish <S%H6><s%> from the way, <S%H1870><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> his wrath <S%H639><s%> is kindled <S%H1197><s%> but a little. <S%H4592><s%> Blessed <S%H835><s%> are all <S%H3605><s%> they that put their trust <S%H2620><s%> in him.
